    kineticstoolkit.inversedynamics module¶

    Provide functions to calculate inverse dynamics.

    Warning

    This module is currently experimental and its API and behaviour could be modified in the future.

    Functions

    calculate_com_acceleration(ts, filter_func, …)

    Calculate the acceleration of the segment’s center of mass.

    calculate_com_position(ts, inertial_constants)

    Calculate the position of the segment’s center of mass.

    calculate_proximal_wrench(ts, inertial_constants)

    Calculate the proximal wrench based on a TimeSeries.

    calculate_segment_angles(ts)

    Calculate the segment’s projection angles in the three axes.

    calculate_segment_rotation_rates(ts, …)

    Calculate the segments’ projected angular velocities and accelerations.

    get_anthropometrics(segment_name, total_mass)

    Get anthropometric values for a given segment name.
    kineticstoolkit.inversedynamics.calculate_com_acceleration(ts, filter_func, **kwargs)¶

    Calculate the acceleration of the segment’s center of mass.

    Warning

    Unreleased function.

    This function is currently being developped and has not been released yet. It may not have been validated, it may change signature and behaviour drastically or even be deleted.

    Adds the data key ‘COMAcceleration’ to the TimeSeries based on the specified filter function.

    Parameters

    • ts (TimeSeries) – A TimeSeries with the at least a ‘COMPosition’ data key.

    • filter_func (str) – ‘savgol’: calculate the acceleration using the 2nd order coefficient of a moving polynomial. ‘butter’: no-lag 2nd order filter followed by a centered derivate.

    • parameters for a Savistky-Golay filter (savgol) (Additionnal) –

    • ----------------------------------------------------------- –

    • window_length – The length of the filter window. window_length must be a positive odd integer less or equal than the length of the TimeSeries.

    • poly_order – Optional. The order of the polynomial used to fit the samples. polyorder must be less than window_length. The default is 2.

    • parameters for a Butterworth filter (butter) (Additionnal) –

    • -------------------------------------------------------- –

    • fc – Cut-off frequency in Hz.

    • order – Optional. Order of the filter. The default is 2.

    Returns

    A copy of the input timeseries plus the ‘COMAcceleration’ data key.

    Return type

    TimeSeries

    kineticstoolkit.inversedynamics.calculate_com_position(ts, inertial_constants)¶

    Calculate the position of the segment’s center of mass.

    Warning

    Unreleased function.

    This function is currently being developped and has not been released yet. It may not have been validated, it may change signature and behaviour drastically or even be deleted.

    Adds the data key ‘COMPosition’ to the TimeSeries based on the ‘COMProximalRatio’ key of the dict inertial_constants.

    Parameters

    • ts (TimeSeries) –

      A TimeSeries with the following data keys:

      • ProximalJointPosition (Nx4)

      • DistalJointPosition (Nx4)

    • inertial_constants (Dict[str, float]) – A dict with at least a ‘COMProximalRatio’ key, which is the distance between the segment’s center of mass and the proximal joint, as a ratio of the distance between both joints.

    Returns

    A copy of the input timeseries plus the ‘COMPosition’ data key.

    Return type

    TimeSeries

    kineticstoolkit.inversedynamics.calculate_proximal_wrench(ts, inertial_constants)¶

    Calculate the proximal wrench based on a TimeSeries.

    Warning

    Unreleased function.

    This function is currently being developped and has not been released yet. It may not have been validated, it may change signature and behaviour drastically or even be deleted.

    This function is based on R. Dumas, R. Aissaoui, and J. A. De Guise, “A 3D generic inverse dynamic method using wrench notation and quaternion algebra,” Comput Meth Biomech Biomed Eng, vol. 7, no. 3, pp. 159–166, 2004.

    Parameters

    • ts (TimeSeries) –

      A TimeSeries with the following data keys:

      • ProximalJointPosition (Nx4)

      • DistalJointPosition (Nx4)

      • ForceApplicationPosition (Nx4)

      • DistalForces (Nx4)

      • DistalMoments (Nx4)

      and these ones (although they can be reconstructed automatically by the function, in which case warnings are issued):

      • COMPosition (Nx4)

      • COMAcceleration (Nx4)

      • SegmentAngles (Nx3)

    • inertial_constants (Dict[str, float]) –

      A dict that contains the following keys:

      • ’Mass’: Mass of the segment, in kg.

      • ’GyrationCOMRatio’: Radius of gyration around the segment’s center of mass, as a ratio of the distance between both joints.

      This dict may be generated using the get_anthropometrics function.

    Returns

    A copy of the input timeseries plus these extra data keys:

    • ’ProximalForces’ (Nx4)

    • ’ProximalMoments’ (Nx4)

    Return type

    TimeSeries

    kineticstoolkit.inversedynamics.calculate_segment_angles(ts)¶

    Calculate the segment’s projection angles in the three axes.

    Warning

    Unreleased function.

    This function is currently being developped and has not been released yet. It may not have been validated, it may change signature and behaviour drastically or even be deleted.

    Parameters

    ts (TimeSeries) –

    A TimeSeries with the following data keys:

    • ProximalJointPosition (Nx4)

    • DistalJointPosition (Nx4)

    Returns

    A copy of the input timeseries plus the ‘SegmentAngles’ data key, represented as an Nx3 numpy array.

    Return type

    TimeSeries

    kineticstoolkit.inversedynamics.calculate_segment_rotation_rates(ts, filter_func, **kwargs)¶

    Calculate the segments’ projected angular velocities and accelerations.

    Warning

    Unreleased function.

    This function is currently being developped and has not been released yet. It may not have been validated, it may change signature and behaviour drastically or even be deleted.

    Parameters

    • ts (TimeSeries) – A TimeSeries with at least the ‘SegmentAngles’ key (Nx3).

    • filter_func (str) – ‘savgol’: calculate the velocity and acceleration using the 1st and 2nd order coefficients of a moving polynomial. ‘butter’: no-lag 2nd order filter followed by centered derivates.

    • parameters for a Savistky-Golay filter (savgol) (Additionnal) –

    • ----------------------------------------------------------- –

    • window_length – The length of the filter window. window_length must be a positive odd integer less or equal than the length of the TimeSeries.

    • poly_order – Optional. The order of the polynomial used to fit the samples. polyorder must be less than window_length. The default is 2.

    • parameters for a Butterworth filter (butter) (Additionnal) –

    • -------------------------------------------------------- –

    • fc – Cut-off frequency in Hz.

    • order – Optional. Order of the filter. The default is 2.

    Returns

    A copy of the input timeseries plus the ‘AngularVelocity’ and ‘AngularAcceleration’ data keys (each Nx3).

    Return type

    TimeSeries

    kineticstoolkit.inversedynamics.get_anthropometrics(segment_name, total_mass)¶

    Get anthropometric values for a given segment name.

    Warning

    Unreleased function.

    This function is currently being developped and has not been released yet. It may not have been validated, it may change signature and behaviour drastically or even be deleted.

    For the moment, only this table is available:

    D. A. Winter, Biomechanics and Motor Control of Human Movement, 4th ed. University of Waterloo, Waterloo, Ontario, Canada, John Wiley & Sons, 2009.

    Parameters

    • segment_name (str) –

      The name of the segment, either:

      • ’Hand’ (wrist axis to knuckle II of middle finger)

      • ’Forearm’ (elbow axis to ulnar styloid)

      • ’UpperArm’ (glenohumeral axis to elbow axis)

      • ’ForearmHand’ (elbow axis to ulnar styloid)

      • ’TotalArm’ (glenohumeral joint to ulnar styloid)

      • ’Foot’ (lateral malleolus to head metatarsal II)

      • ’Leg’ (femoral condyles to medial malleolus)

      • ’Thigh’ (greater trochanter to femoral condyles)

      • ’FootLeg’ (fomeral condyles to medial malleolus)

      • ’TotalLeg’ (greater trochanter to medial malleolus)

      • ’TrunkHeadNeck’ (greater trochanter to glenohumeral joint)

      • ’HeadArmsTrunk’ (greater trochanter to glenohumeral joint)

    • total_mass (float) – The total mass of the person, in kg.

    Returns

    A dict with the following keys:

    • ’Mass’ : Mass of the segment, in kg.

    • ’COMProximalRatio’ : Distance between the segment’s center of mass and the proximal joint, as a ratio of the distance between both joints.

    • ’COMDistalRatio’ : Distance between the segment’s center of mass and the distal joint, as a ratio of the distance between both joints.

    • ’GyrationCOMRatio’: Radius of gyration around the segment’s center of mass, as a ratio of the distance between both joints.

    • ’GyrationProximalRatio’: Radius of gyration around the segment’s

      proximal joint, as a ratio of the distance between both joints.

    • ’GyrationDistalRatio’: Radius of gyration around the segment’s

      distal joint, as a ratio of the distance between both joints.

    Return type

    Dict[str, float]
